item.title: Stock Market Weekly Recap: SENSEX, NIFTY tumble 5% to log biggest weekly fall in 2 years - Upstox
item.description:
Stock Market Weekly Recap: SENSEX, NIFTY tumble 5% to log biggest weekly fall in 2 years

Date: December 20, 2024

Source: Upstox

This week, the equity markets experienced a significant downturn, marked by a 5% decline in benchmark indices SENSEX and NIFTY, totaling the largest weekly loss in two years.

  • The NIFTY IT index dropped 4.8% after reaching a lifetime high the previous week.
  • BSE-listed companies lost nearly ₹17 lakh crore in market capitalization.
  • Despite the downturn, the NIFTY Pharma index saw a modest increase of 1.6%.
“The correction was triggered by cautious trading ahead of the US Federal Reserve’s policy decisions.”

The correction is attributed to investor jitters stemming from the US Federal Reserve's anticipated changes in interest rate policies, leading to a global sell-off.

Analysts suggest a potential pull-back rally in the coming week, anticipating a possible “Santa rally” during the holiday season.

item.title: Why Share Market Fell Today? Know Top Reasons For Stock Market Crash On December 20 - News18
item.description:
Why Share Market Fell Today? Know Top Reasons For Stock Market Crash On December 20

Date: December 20, 2024

Source: News18

The Indian stock market witnessed a sharp decline today, with the BSE Sensex plummeting 1,176 points to close at 78,041.59, while the NSE Nifty dropped 364.20 points to end at 23,587.5.

  • IT stocks initially provided relief but soon succumbed to broader market pressure.
  • Significant declines in mid- and small-cap stocks, impacting investor sentiment.
  • The hawkish stance of the US Federal Reserve dampened market outlook.
  • Foreign institutional investors have turned aggressive sellers, offloading Rs 12,230 crore of Indian equities.
  • The Nifty's technical breach of key moving averages increased selling pressure.
“The sell-off has been widespread, with significant declines in mid- and small-cap stocks,” said Vinod Nair, head of research at Geojit Financial Services.

Investors are advised to adopt a cautious approach, focusing on quality large-cap stocks with reasonable valuations.

item.title: Sensex, Nifty suffer 5% weekly loss, worst decline since June 2022 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Sensex and Nifty Suffer 5% Weekly Loss, Worst Decline Since June 2022

Date: Dec 20, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Sensex and Nifty have recorded their largest weekly losses in over two years, with both indices falling more than 5% as global market volatility dampens investor sentiment.

  • Sensex closed near 78,000, down 1.5% from the previous session.
  • Nifty dropped below 23,600, also losing 1.5%.
  • This week marks the steepest weekly decline since June 2022.
  • Investor sentiment adversely affected by the US Federal Reserve's cautious outlook on interest rate cuts.
  • European and Asian markets experienced declines; Stoxx 600 down 1% this week.
  • Concerns over a potential US government shutdown have risen following rejected funding plans.
“Indian markets are trying to shake off the global 'risk off' sentiment...but the volatility is making any rally fragile for now.” - Ajay Bagga, Banking and Market Expert

This week's severe drop reflects significant unease among global investors and presents challenges for the Indian markets moving forward.

item.title: UltraTech Cements receives green flag from CCI to acquire majority stake in India Cements | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
UltraTech Cements Receives Approval to Acquire Majority Stake in India Cements

Date: Friday, [Date not specified] Source: PTI

UltraTech Cement has received approval from the Competition Commission of India (CCI) to acquire a majority stake in India Cements, expanding its presence in the southern cement market.

  • The CCI granted UltraTech a license to acquire up to 26% of India Cements' equity share capital.
  • UltraTech's proposed acquisition includes a 32.72% stake from the promoters of India Cements.
  • The approval was facilitated by J Sagar Associates, legal advisors to UltraTech.
  • This move is part of UltraTech's strategy to enhance its operations in Tamil Nadu, a rapidly growing market.
"Competition Commission of India (CCI) approves UltraTech Cement Ltd's acquisition of India Cements Ltd," the competition watchdog stated.

As of now, UltraTech leads the Indian cement market with a capacity of 156.66 million tonnes of grey cement per annum.

item.title: Personal Loan: Is moratorium a boon or a bane? Find out how it affects your EMI and interest payments | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Personal Loan: Is Moratorium a Boon or a Bane?

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Live Mint

The article discusses the implications of a moratorium on personal loan payments, explaining how it affects borrowers' EMI and interest payments.

  • The moratorium allows borrowers to delay payments but results in accruing interest.
  • Interest is added to the principal amount, increasing total loan liability during the moratorium.
  • Banks may extend loan tenure to keep EMIs lower post-moratorium.
  • If tenure is unchanged, EMIs rise sharply due to accrued interest.
  • Borrowers might pay more over the loan's lifespan due to the moratorium, despite short-term cash flow relief.

Notable Illustrations

For a ₹5 lakh personal loan at 12% interest over 36 months, without a moratorium, total repayment is ₹5,97,857, while with a moratorium, it rises to ₹6,27,857.

It is advised to use a personal loan EMI calculator to assess the impacts of the moratorium on repayment amounts.

In conclusion, while the moratorium may offer temporary relief, it can increase long-term financial obligations for borrowers.

item.title: RBI fines IndusInd Bank ₹27 lakh over non-compliance | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
RBI Fines IndusInd Bank ₹27 Lakh for Non-Compliance

Publication Date: November 20, 2024

Source: Live Mint

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has imposed a monetary penalty of ₹27 lakh on IndusInd Bank Ltd. for failing to comply with regulatory norms by opening savings accounts for ineligible entities.

  • The monetary penalty amounts to ₹27.30 lakh.
  • The RBI's inspection revealed non-compliance with the 'Reserve Bank of India (Interest Rate on Deposits) Directions, 2016.'
  • The inspection assessed the bank's financial position as of March 31, 2023.
  • The penalty does not affect the validity of any transactions made by the bank with its customers.
  • IndusInd Bank reported a 39.5% YoY decline in consolidated net profit for the July-September quarter.
“RBI found, inter alia, that the charge pertaining to opening of certain savings deposit accounts in the name of ineligible entities was sustained, warranting imposition of monetary penalty,” the statement said.

This fine underscores the importance of regulatory compliance in the banking sector and aims to ensure that banks operate within prescribed guidelines to protect consumers and maintain a robust financial system.

item.title: Massive Announcement From Pi Network (PI): Details - CryptoPotato
item.description:
Massive Announcement From Pi Network (PI): Details

Date: October 2023

Source: CryptoPotato

Pi Network announced that 18 million users have completed KYC verification, with potential plans to launch an open mainnet by Q1 2025, resulting in varied community reactions.

  • Pi Network has seen significant growth with 18 million KYC completions.
  • Open mainnet launch is anticipated by Q1 2025.
  • Warnings have been issued to avoid scams and to use only official channels.
“Thanks to recent major speed upgrades, KYC applications and Mainnet migrations are processed faster than ever.”

Community members have expressed mixed feelings about the announcement, with some feeling encouraged while others are disappointed about the timeline.

item.title: Kia Syros Could Get An EV Version Soon, Launch Expected In 2026 - CarDekho
item.description:
Kia Syros Could Get An EV Version Soon, Launch Expected In 2026

Publication Date: N/A | Source: CarDekho.com

The Kia Syros is set to potentially launch its all-electric version in India by 2026, competing with other EVs like Tata Nexon EV and Mahindra XUV400 EV, and expected to offer a driving range of approximately 400 km.

  • The Syros EV will likely be based on the reinforced K1 platform.
  • Design updates may include EV-specific features like revised bumpers.
  • The cabin layout will remain largely unchanged with EV-specific accents.
  • Expected pricing starts from Rs 15 lakh (ex-showroom).
“Although Kia is yet to reveal the battery pack and electric motor specifications for the Syros EV, we expect it to offer a claimed driving range of around 400 km.”

The Syros EV aims to incorporate the familiar features of its ICE counterpart while introducing elements unique to electric vehicles, marking a significant shift in Kia's offerings in the Indian market.

item.title: 'Entire Credit Score Outsourced To A Private Entity': Amicus To Supreme Court In Plea Alleging Data... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Hears Plea Over Data Privacy Violations by Foreign Credit Companies

Publication Date: [Insert publication date] | Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court is currently reviewing a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) that alleges data privacy violations by foreign credit information companies. The Amicus Curiae raised concerns over the outsourcing of credit scores to private organizations and the absence of a regulatory framework.

  • The case is about foreign companies allegedly mishandling sensitive financial information of Indian citizens.
  • The Amicus, Senior Advocate K Parmeswar, emphasized the lack of statutory regulation governing these organizations.
  • The matter was adjourned to allow respondents time to submit their affidavits.
  • Dr AM Singhvi, representing some respondents, argued that the petition is frivolous.
  • The petition seeks action from various governmental ministries against alleged privacy violations.
“There is no statutory framework so far as the duty of that organization is concerned.” - K Parmeswar, Amicus Curiae

This case highlights the critical intersection of data privacy and financial regulation in the context of increasingly globalized credit scoring practices.

item.title: Stock Market Crash: Nifty posts worst week of 2024, losing ₹19 lakh crore of investor wealth - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Stock Market Crash: Nifty posts worst week of 2024, losing ₹19 lakh crore of investor wealth

Date: October 2024 Source: Economic Times

The Nifty 50 index ended with significant losses, marking its worst week of 2024 and leading to a loss of nearly ₹19 lakh crore in investor wealth.

  • The Nifty 50 index dropped over 350 points on Friday.
  • 48 out of 50 Nifty stocks ended the week with losses.
  • The Sensex lost nearly 1,200 points during the same period.
  • IT stocks declined despite positive guidance from Accenture Plc.
  • Global market concerns from the US Federal Reserve's hawkish outlook affected investor sentiment.
  • Some stocks hit 52-week lows, including Reliance Industries and Tata Consumer Products.
  • Experts are watching critical support levels for potential market rebounds.
“The market has been going through a little bit of turmoil... but in case, these levels do not hold, then I think that is a further slide towards 23,200 to 22,500.” - Vaishali Parekh, Prabhudas Lilladher

In conclusion, while the current market conditions are challenging, experts suggest a potential recovery, driven by government expenditure in the upcoming months.

item.title: Skoda Superb Now Available With Up To Rs. 18 Lakh Discounts In India - GaadiWaadi.com
item.description:
Skoda Superb Now Available With Up To Rs. 18 Lakh Discounts In India

Publication Date: April 2024
Source: Gaadi Waadi

Skoda Auto India has introduced discounts of up to Rs. 18 lakh on remaining stocks of the imported Skoda Superb, available in select cities. This makes the premium sedan more attractive even as global markets move on to its fourth generation.

  • Skoda announced the return of the Superb in the Laurin & Klement trim at Rs. 54 lakh (ex-showroom).
  • Only 100 units of the car were brought to India, produced in the 2023 calendar year.
  • The 2.0L TSI EVO turbocharged petrol engine delivers 190 PS of power and 320 Nm of torque with a seven-speed DSG transmission.
  • Features include a spacious boot, a virtual cockpit, touchscreen infotainment, and advanced safety equipment.
“The discounts make the offering more attractive than ever for enthusiasts craving a premium sedan.”

The Skoda Superb's attractive discounts and premium features position it as a valuable choice for luxury car buyers in India.

item.title: New Bajaj Chetak launched in India at Rs 1.20 lakh - BikeWale
item.description:
Bajaj Launches New Chetak 35 Series Scooter in India

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

This all-new Bajaj Chetak 35 series scooter, priced at Rs 1.20 lakh for the mid-spec variant, features a modern design and advanced technology.

Key features of the new Chetak include:

  • Available in three variants: 3501, 3502, and 3503.
  • Loaded with features including smartphone connectivity and a new touchscreen display in the top variant.
  • Offers a range of 153km on a full charge with a 3.5kW battery.
  • Powerful 4kW permanent magnet motor with a top speed of 73kmph.
Bajaj claims the scooter can go from 0-80% charged in just three hours using the new quick charger.

The Chetak 35 series is expected to compete effectively in the growing electric scooter market with its innovative features and modern design.

item.title: Raghuram Rajan Blames UPA Corruption For Bank NPAs, Lauds Modi Government’s Write-Offs - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Raghuram Rajan Blames UPA Corruption For Bank NPAs, Lauds Modi Government’s Write-Offs

Publication Date: January 2024 | Source: Bloomberg Quint

In a recent interview, former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan attributed the rise in bank non-performing assets (NPAs) to corruption during the UPA government. He commended the Modi administration for its efforts in resolving these issues and helping banks recover.

  • Rajan claims UPA-era corruption was a primary cause of NPAs.
  • He recounted a conversation with Arun Jaitley regarding the need to address bad loans.
  • Post-financial crisis challenges included project troubles and regulatory delays.
  • Rajan emphasized the need for a thorough asset quality review of banks to identify bad loans.
  • He highlighted the importance of bank cleanups to restore lending capabilities.
"It was necessary to clean up the system; otherwise lending would be hampered." - Raghuram Rajan

This analysis by Rajan underscores the importance of accountability and systematic reform in addressing long-standing financial issues in India's banking sector.
